byline.contributor: Ben Protess contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Olympus president and chairman Tsuyoshi Kikukawa steps down in wake of company scandal over a series of costly and questionable acquisitions; investors question whether his replacement Shuichi Takayama, who has long ties to company and board, will be able to conduct comprehensive probe of claimed misdeeds.
snippet: The Japanese firm Olympus said its president and chairman Tsuyoshi Kikukawa had stepped down after the company became embroiled in a scandal over a series of costly acquisitions.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese firm Olympus said its president and chairman Tsuyoshi Kikukawa had stepped down after the company became embroiled in a scandal over a series of costly acquisitions.
